question:
In a certain code language,
‘A + B’ means ‘A is the mother of B’,
‘A – B’ means ‘A is the father of B’,
‘A $ B’ means ‘A is the son of B’,
‘A % B’ means ‘A is the sister of B’,
‘A / B’ means ‘A is the wife of B’
‘A = B’ means ‘A is the brother of B’.
Which of the following means A is the daughter of K?
i. A + K / J – P = D
ii. J % P = K + A = D
iii. K + A / P – D % J
iv. D + K = A / P – J
solution:
(c)

A is the daughter of K.

question:
Three statements are given followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and III. Assuming the statements to be true, even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements.
Statements:
No card is a parcel.
All cards are envelopes.
Some envelopes are bags.
Conclusions:
I. All envelopes can never be parcels.
II. No card is a bag.
III. At least some bags are postcards.
solution:
(a)

Only I follows.

question: Who among the following has authored the play ‘Nil Darpan’?
solution: (c)Dinabandhu Mitra. Nil Darpan is a Bengali-language play written in 1858-59 by Dinabandhu Mitra, depicting the oppression of indigo farmers by British planters in Bengal. His other works include ‘Nabin Tapasvini’, ‘Biye Pagla Budo’, ‘Sadhabar Ekadashi’, and ‘Kamale Kamini’. Other authors and their works : Sarojini Naidu - ‘The Golden Threshold’, ‘The Bird of Time’. Chittaranjan Das - ‘India for Indians’, ‘Freedom Through Disobedience’.

question: Which of the following awards was won by Lata Mangeshkar in the year 2001?
solution: (d)Bharat Ratna. Lata Mangeshkar was an Indian playback singer born in Indore. She received the Padma Bhushan in 1969, the Padma Vibhushan in 1999, the Dadasaheb Phalke Award in 1989, and the 'Officier de la Legion d'Honneur,' France's highest civilian award, in 2009. She is also renowned for singing the famous song 'Aye mere watan ke logo’.

question: Which of the following is a correct order of basicity?
solution: (d)CsOH>KOH>NaOH>LiOH. This order is due to the increasing size of the alkali metal ions, which leads to better solvation and greater basicity. As you move down the group, the basicity increases because the larger alkali metal ions (like Cs⁺) can more easily dissociate and interact with water compared to the smaller ions (like Li⁺).

question: Who founded the Prarthana Samaj in Mumbai in 1867?
solution: (a)Atmaram Pandurang. Prarthana Samaj was founded with an aim to make people believe in one God and worship only one God. Other Societies and Founders: Brahmo Samaj (1828) - Ram Mohan Roy, Servants of India Society (1905) - Gopal Krishna Gokhale, Seva Samiti Boy Scouts Association (1914) - Shri Ram Bajpai.

question: Who among the following formed the Bihar Provincial Kisan Sabha in 1929?
solution: (d)Swami Sahajanand Saraswati. The Bihar Provincial Kisan Sabha (BPKS) emerged in response to the agricultural crisis, worsened by the Great Depression of 1929. Swami Sahajanand Saraswati wrote "The Other Side of the Shield" and "Rent Reduction in Bihar," addressing peasant struggles and land reforms. Jayaprakash Narayan founded the Congress Socialist Party (CSP) in 1934 and the Praja Socialist Party (PSP) in 1952, while Kunwar Singh was a key leader in the Indian Rebellion of 1857 from Bihar.

question: In which city was the first golf club of India situated?
solution: (d)Kolkata. The Royal Calcutta Golf Club, established in 1829, is the oldest golf club in India and the first outside Great Britain. Other Golf Clubs in India : Bombay Presidency Golf Club (1927), Patna Golf Club (1916), Coimbatore Golf Club (1985), Chandigarh Golf Club (1962). Golf terminologies : Ace, Break, Par, Fade, Slice, Hook.

question: Which article has a similar provision to that of Article 32 and deals with writ jurisdiction?
solution: (d)Article 226. In India, writs are issued by the Supreme Court under Article 32 of the Constitution of India and by the High Courts under Article 226 of the Constitution of India. There are 5 types of writs issued in India - Habeas Corpus (to have the body of), Mandamus (we command), Certiorari (to be certified or to be informed), Prohibition (to forbid) and Quo-Warranto (by what authority or warrant).

question: Mahendravarman I was the ruler of which of the following dynasties?
solution: (d)Pallava. Mahendravarman I ruled the southern portions of present-day Andhra region and northern regions of what forms present-day Tamil Nadu in India. He took up the title ‘Chitrakarapuli’, ‘Matavilasa’, and ‘Vichirachita’. The Pallava Dynasty was founded by Simhavishnu.

question: What challenge does foreign investment often face in India?
solution: (b)Inconsistent regulatory environment can lead to difficulties in compliance and planning for investors, ultimately affecting their confidence and willingness to invest in the country. Foreign investment refers to when an investor from one country purchases ownership of an asset or business in another country.

question: Who is the Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science and Technology as of July 2023?
solution: (d)Jitendra Singh. Ministers of State (Independent Charge) as of August 2024 : Rao Inderjit Singh - Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation. Arjun Ram Meghwal - Ministry of Law and Justice. Jayant Chaudhary - Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship. Jadhav Prataprao Ganpatrao - Ministry of Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homoeopathy (AYUSH).

question: Lathmar Holi is primarily celebrated in the state of:
solution: (c)Uttar Pradesh. Lathmar Holi is celebrated in the twin towns of Barsana and Nandgaon, also known as the towns of Radha and Krishna respectively. Famous festivals of Uttar Pradesh - Gaurav Mahotsav, Ramotsav, Taj Mahotsav, Ayodhya Deepotsav, Ganga Mahotsav. Arunachal Pradesh - Sangken, Mopin, Pongtu. Himachal Pradesh - Halda, Doongri, Chet Festival, Kullu Dussehra. Karnataka - Ugadi, Mysuru Dasara, Kambala, Gowri Habba.

question: Which of the following is NOT a condition for the President’s office in India?
option_1: He shall not be entitled, without payment of rent, to use his official residence
option_2: He shall not be a member of either House of the Parliament.
option_3: The allowances shall not be diminished during his term of office.
option_4: He shall not hold any office of profit.
solution: (a) Article 59 of the Constitution of India outlines the conditions for the office of the President of India. Article 59 (3) - The President shall be entitled without payment of rent to the use of his official residences and shall be also entitled to such emoluments, allowances and privileges as may be determined by Parliament by law. Important Articles related to the President: Article 52 - The President of India. Article 54 - Election of President. Article 55 - Manner of election of President. Article 56 - Term of office of President.

question: Which Indian among the following has his name in Time Magazine’s list of ‘100 most influential people of 2021’?
solution: (b)Narendra Modi is the 14th and current prime minister of India since 26 May 2014. He was the chief minister of Gujarat from 2001 to 2014. His awards : Order of Abdulaziz Al Saud (the highest Civilian Award of Saudi Arabia) in 2016; State Order of Ghazi Amir Amanullah Khan (the highest Civilian honor of Afghanistan) in 2016; Champions of the Earth Award in 2018; Order of St. Andrew award (the highest civilian award in Russia) in 2019 etc.

question: When the analysis of population density is done by calculating it through net cultivated area, then the measure is termed as:
solution: (b) Physiological density. Density of population is expressed as the number of persons per unit area. Physiological density =total populationnet cultivated area. Agricultural density is the number of farmers per unit of arable land. Agricultural population includes cultivators and agricultural labourers and their family members.

question: Mohan Veena player, Pandit Vishwa Mohan Bhatt won the ____________ Award in the year 1994.
solution: (c)Grammy. His music album with Ry Cooder, A Meeting by the River, won him a Grammy Award. He also received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1998, the Padma Shri in 2002, and the Padma Bhushan in 2017. Famous Mohan Veena players: Pandit Joydeep Mukherjee, Poly Varghese.

question: Which plateaus are very fertile because they are rich in black soil that is very good for farming?
solution: (d)Deccan lava plateau is a volcanic plateau in west-central India that was formed by the solidification of lava from deep within the Earth. It is a triangular landmass that lies to the south of the river Narmada. The African plateau is famous for gold and diamond mining. The Katanga Plateau in the Democratic Republic of the Congo is known for its rich deposits of copper and uranium.

question: Which of the following pairs is INCORRECT regarding the grade of organisation and its example?
solution: (d) Euplectella, is a genus of glass sponges which includes the well-known Venus' Flower Basket, exhibits a cellular grade of organization rather than a tissue-organ grade. A cellular grade of organisation is an aggregation of cells that are functionally differentiated.

question: Who is the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu as of July 2023?
solution: (d)MK Stalin is the 8th Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu. As of August 2024, the chief ministers of Indian states are: Pinarayi Vijayan (Kerala), Mamata Banerjee (West Bengal), Siddaramaiah (Karnataka), Pramod Sawant (Goa), Nara Chandrababu Naidu (Andhra Pradesh), and Pema Khandu (Arunachal Pradesh).

question: Which of the following states is the biggest producer of Pulses?
solution: (a)Madhya Pradesh. Based on the production estimates for the year 2022-23, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Rajasthan are the top three pulses producing states in the country. India is the largest producer of pulses in the world.

question: In which year was Project Tiger launched in India?
solution: (b) On April 1, 1973, Project Tiger was officially launched at the Corbett Tiger Reserve, initially including nine tiger reserves. International Tiger Day is celebrated annually on July 29. The Wildlife Protection Act was passed in 1972. Projects in India related to animals :Project Hangul (1970), Project Crocodile (1975), Project Elephant (1992), Project Rhino (2005), Project Gangetic Dolphin - (2009), Project Snow Leopard (2009), Project Great Indian Bustard (2012).

question: The head office of Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is located in ________.
solution: (a)Mumbai. BCCI is the principal national governing body of the sport of cricket in India established in 1928. RE Grant Govan was the first president and De Mello was the first Secretary of the BCCI. International Cricket Council (ICC) - Headquarters (Dubai, United Arab Emirates).

question: Which of the following decomposition reactions is NOT a redox reaction?
solution: (d)Decomposition of calcium carbonate. A redox reaction is defined as a reaction in which oxidation and reduction take place simultaneously. The decomposition of calcium carbonate (CaCO3) into calcium oxide (CaO) and carbon dioxide (CO2) does not involve a change in the oxidation states of the elements involved, making it a non-redox reaction.

question: Which of the following statements best defines the monoecious?
option_1: A flower with both androecium and gynoecium
solution: (a) Monoecious plants bear both purely male and purely female flowers. Examples include castor, cucumber, and maize. In contrast, dioecious plants have male and female flowers on separate plants, such as papaya.

question: ___________ is an industry association and self-regulatory organisation (SRO) whose primary objective is to work towards the robust development of the microfinance sector.
solution: (b)Microfinance Institutions Network (MFIN) was established in 2009. A microfinance institution is a provider of credit. However, the size of the loans are smaller than those granted by traditional banks. Reserve Bank of India (RBI) oversees microfinance institutions in India. MFIN examples Equitas Small Finance, ESAF Microfinance and Investments (P) Ltd, Fusion Microfinance Pvt Ltd, Annapurna Microfinance Pvt Ltd, BSS Microfinance Limited, Asirvad Microfinance Limited, Cashpor Micro Credit, Bandhan Financial Services Limited.

question: Details about Sudarshana lake is given in a rock inscription at Girnar (Junagarh), which was composed to record the achievements of the Shaka ruler _________.
solution: (b)Rudradaman I belonged to the line of the Saka rulers and was the grandson of Chastana, the founder of the Kardamaka dynasty. Junagadh inscription is written in the Sanskrit​ language. It is located near Girnar hill near Junagadh in Gujarat. The Junagadh rock contains inscriptions of Ashoka (one of the fourteen Major Rock Edicts of Ashoka), Rudradaman I and Skandagupta.

question: Which of the following statements is sufficient to conclude that two triangles are congruent?
option_1: These have two equal sides and the same perimeter
option_2: These have the same area and the same base.
option_3: One side and one angle of both triangles are equal.
option_4: These have the same base and the same height.
solution:
(a) If two sides of both triangles are equal, and the perimeter is the same, the third side must also be equal because the perimeter is the sum of all sides. Therefore, all three sides of both triangles would be equal, satisfying the SSS (Side-Side-Side) congruence condition.
So, Option (a) is sufficient to conclude that the two triangles are congruent.

question: The average marks (out of 100) of boys and girls in an examination are 75 and 80, respectively. If the average marks of all the students in that examination are 78. Find the ratio of the number of boys to the number of girls.
solution:
(a)

Required ratio = 2 : 3

question: If the sum of two sides of an equilateral triangle is 16 cm, then find the third side.
solution:
(d) Let the side of an equilateral triangle be x
According to the question,
2x = 16
x = 8 cm
We know that an equilateral triangle all side equal to each other so the third side will be 8 cm.

question:
The following table shows the total candidates appeared and number of candidates present, in different exam centres – P, Q and R. Study the table and answer the question that follows.

‘Total’ denotes total candidates applied for the centre,‘Present’ denotes the candidates appeared. In which year was the number of absentees the second highest in total of all centres?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1730698209886.png
solution:
(d)
The number of absentees in 2018 = (64 + 65 + 65) - (60 + 45 + 55) = 34
The number of absentees in 2017 = (50 + 75 + 45) - (45 + 55 + 40) = 30
The number of absentees in 2020 = (55 + 80 + 90) - (44 + 66 + 85) = 30
The number of absentees in 2019 = (80 + 84 + 70) - (69 + 72 + 62) = 31
It is clear from the above expression that in 2019 the number of absentees is the second highest in total of all centres.

question: Which of the following can be the value of ‘k’ so that the number 217924k is divisible by 6?
solution:
(c) A number is divisible by 6 if it is divisible by both 2 and 3:
Divisibility of 2 : A number is divisible by 2 if it is an even number,
Divisibility of 3 : A number is divisible by 3 if the sum of all digits of that number is divisible by 3.
Now, 217924k
⇒ 2 + 1 + 7 + 9 + 2 + 4 + k = 25 + k
The possible value of k can be 0, 2 , 4 , 6 , 8
But the sum of number must be multiple of 3 so the value of k will be 2

question:
Read the given information and answer the question that follows.
The following table gives the percentage of marks obtained by seven students in six different subjects in an examination.
The number in the brackets give the maximum marks in each subject.

If someone secured all the highest scores that have been obtained by some student or the other in the six subjects as given in the table above, what would be the exact overall percentage score obtained by that student?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1730698210160.png
solution:
(a)
Highest marks in maths = 150 × 100100 = 150
Highest marks in chemistry = 130 × 80100 = 104
Highest marks in Physics = 120 × 90100 = 108
Highest marks in Geography = 100 × 95100 = 95
Highest marks in History = 60 × 90100 = 54
Highest marks in Computer science = 40 × 90100 = 36
Required percentage = 150 + 104 + 108 + 95 + 54 + 36150 + 130 + 120 + 100 + 60 + 40 × 100
= 547600 × 100 = 5476 = 9116%

question: The value of sin230° - sin240° + sin245° - sin255° - sin235° + sin245° - sin250° + sin260° is:
solution:
(d) sin230° - sin240° + sin245° - sin255° - sin235° + sin245° - sin250° + sin260°
= (sin230° + sin260°) - (sin240° + sin250°) + (sin245° + sin245°) - (sin255°+ sin235°)
= 1 - 1 + 1 - 1 (∵ sin2θ + sin2(90° - θ) = 1)
= 0

question: The value of cos229° + cos261° is:
solution:
(c) cos229° + cos261°
= cos229° + cos2(90° - 29°)
= cos229° + sin229°
= 1

question: An article is marked at ₹550. If it is sold at a discount of 40%, then the selling price becomes 10% more than its cost price. What is the cost price (in ₹)?
solution:
(c) Let the CP of an article be 100 units
Given: MP of an article = ₹ 550
SP of an article = 550 × 60100 = ₹ 330
According to the question,
110 units = 330
100 units = 330110 × 100 = ₹ 300

question:
The given table shows the percentage of marks obtained by three students in three different subjects in an institute. (maximum marks are given in brackets)

If in order to pass the exam, a minimum of 105 marks are needed in History, how many students pass in the exam?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1730698210479.png
solution:
(b) According to the question,
Passing marks of Ram in History = 175 × 54100 = 94.5
Passing marks of Mohan in History = 175 × 51100 = 89.25
Passing marks of Shyam in History = 175 × 75100 = 131.25
Hence, only 1 student passed the examination.

question: Fill pipe P is 21 times faster than fill pipe Q. If Q can fill a cistern in 110 minutes, find the time it takes to fill the cistern when both fill pipes are opened together.
solution:
(a)
Ratio of pipe → P : Q
Efficiency → 21 : 1
Now,
Total time to fill the cistern = 110 × 1 = 110 units
Time taken by both pipe to fill the cistern = 11021+1 = 5 minutes

question: The radii of the two cones are in the ratio of 2 : 5 and their volumes are in the ratio of 3 : 5. What is the ratio of their heights?
solution:
(a) Let the height of the two cone be h1 and h2,
According to the question,
⇒ 13πr12h113πr22h2 = 35
⇒ 4×h125×h2 = 35
⇒ h1h2 = 7520 = 154
⇒ h1 : h2 = 15 : 4

question:
Simplify
x3 + 15x2+ 75x + 125x2-25(x - 5)
solution:
(c)x3 + 15x2 + 75x + 125x2 - 25 × (x - 5)
= x3 + 53 + 3 × x × 5(x + 5)x2 - 52 × (x - 5)
= (x + 5)3(x - 5)(x + 5) × (x - 5)
= (x + 5)2
= x2 + 25 + 10x or x2 + 10x + 25

question: Which of the following can be the value of k, if(88 ÷ 8 × k - 3 × 3)(62 - 7 × 5 + k2) = 1 ?
solution:
(a)88 ÷ 8 × k - 3 × 362 - 7 × 5 + k2 = 1
⇒ 11×k-936-35+k2 = 1
⇒ 11k - 9 = 1 + k2
⇒ k2 - 11k + 10 = 0
⇒ k2 - 10k - k + 10 = 0
⇒ k(k - 10) - 1(k - 10) = 0
⇒ (k - 10)(k - 1) = 0
⇒ k = 10 and 1

question: Let O be the centre of the circle and AB and CD are two parallel chords on the same side of the radius. OP is perpendicular to AB and OQ is perpendicular to CD. If AB = 10 cm, CD = 24 cm and PQ = 7 cm, then the diameter (in cm) of the circle is equal to:
solution:
(a)

In ΔOQC,
By using pythagoras theorem,
OQ2 + CQ2 = OC2
OQ2 + 122 = OC2 …….(i)
In ΔOPA,
OP2 + AP2 = OA2
(OQ + 7)2 + 52 = OA2 …….(ii)
Equating the equation (i) and (ii) because OC = OA (radii of the circle)
OQ2 + 122 = (OQ + 7)2 + 52
OQ2 + 144 = OQ2 + 49 + 14OQ + 25
144 - (49 + 25) = 14OQ
70 = 14OQ
OQ = 5 cm
Put the value of OQ in equation (i)
52 + 122 = OC2
OC2 = 25 + 144 = 169
OC = 13
So, the diameter of the circle = 2 × 13 = 26 cm


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1730698210816.png

question: If cosec θ =53, then evaluate (sec2θ-1) × cot2θ ×(1 + cot2θ)
solution:
(c)Given : cosec θ = 53
⇒ (sec2θ - 1) × cot2θ × (1 + cot2θ)
We know,
sec2θ = 1 + tan2θ, cosec2θ = 1 + cot2θ and tan2θ × cot2θ = 1
Then, (1 + tan2θ - 1) × cot2θ × (cosec2θ )
= tan2θ × cot2θ × cosec2θ
= cosec2θ = (53)2 = 259

question: The distance between the centres of two circles of radii 22 cm and 10 cm is 37 cm. If the points of contact of a direct common tangent to these circles are M and Q, then find the length of the line segment MQ.
solution:
(a)

Length of the common tangent(MQ) = (distance between centre of two circle)2-(c1 + c2)2
MQ = (37)2-(22 -10)2 = (37)2-(12)2
MQ = 1369 - 144 = 1225 = 35 cm


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1730698210936.png

question: In a circular race of 840 m, A and B start running in the same direction at the same time from the same point at the speeds of 6 m/s and 12 m/s, respectively. After how much time will they meet next?
solution:
(a) Distance of the circular track = 840 m
Relative speed = 12 - 6 = 6 m/s
Time (they will meet next time) = distancespeed = 8406 = 140 sec.

question: R pays ₹100 to P with ₹5, ₹2 and ₹1 coins. The total number of coins used for paying are 40. What is the number of coins of denomination ₹5 in the payment?
solution:
(d)
Let ₹5, ₹2, ₹1 coins be x,y,z respectively.
According to question,
x + y + z = 40 ….. (i)
5x + 2y + z = 100 … (ii)
On subtracting equation (i) from (ii) we get
4x + y = 60
Now on satisfying the options we find that only option (d) gives positive value of y and no. of coins must be positive.
Hence, no. of ₹5 coins = 13

question: In an election between two candidates, y% of the voters did not vote. 10% of the votes cast were declared invalid, while all the valid votes were cast in favour of either of the two candidates. The candidate who got 59.375% of the valid votes cast was declared elected by 2484 votes. If the number of people eligible to vote in that election was 16,000, what is the value of y?
solution:
(c)
59.375% = 1932
Valid vote difference between two candidate = 6 unit
according to question,
16000(1 - y100) × 910 × 632 = 2484
100 - y = 92
Y = 8

question: Mohan borrows a sum of ₹4,22,092 at the rate of 20% per annum simple interest. At the end of the first year, he repays ₹21,679 towards the return of principal amount borrowed. If Mohan clears all pending dues at the end of the second year, including interest payment that accrued during the first year, how much does he pay (in ₹) at the end of the second year?
solution:
(d) SI =principal × rate × time 100
SI for first year = 422092 × 20 × 1 100 = ₹ 84418.40
Remaining the amount after repays = 422092 - 21679 = ₹ 400413
SI for second year = 400413 × 20 × 1 100 = ₹ 80082.60
Mohan total pay the amount end of the second years = 84418.40 + 400413 + 80082.60 = ₹ 564914

question: Simplify(x2-9)x+3
solution:
(b)(x2-9)x + 3
= (x2- 32)x + 3 = (x-3)(x+3)(x+3) = (x - 3)

question: Rajesh, in his printing press, got an order to print some books, out of which he completed1727 of the order in 34 days. In how many days did he complete the entire order of printing?
solution:
(c) According to the question,
1727 units = 34 days
1 units = 34 × 2717 = 54 days

question: A grocer professes to sell rice at the cost price, but uses a fake weight of 870 g for 1 kg. Find his profit percentage (correct to two decimal places).
solution:
(b) As per question,
original weight = 1000 g
New weight = 870 g
Required Profit % = 1000 - 870870 × 100 = 14.94 %

question:
The following table shows the marks (out of 100) obtained by five students in five different subjects.

Who obtained 79% marks in all the subjects taken together?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1730698211141.png
solution:
(d)
Sumit obtained percentage = 90+88+78+82+68500 × 100 = 4065 = 81.2%
Mohit obtained percentage = 73+84+77+90+95500 × 100 = 4195 = 83.8%
Rohit obtained percentage = 69+76+80+88+94500 × 100 = 4075 = 81.4%
Tarun obtained percentage = 65+80+75+85+90500 × 100 = 3955 = 79%
Hence, Tarun has obtained 79% marks in all the subjects

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Ishika saw the tiger in the forest.
option_1: The tiger saw by Ishika in the forest
option_2: The tiger was seen by the forest in Ishika.
option_3: The tiger was seen by Ishika in the forest.
option_4: The tiger sees Ishika in the forest.
solution:
(c) The tiger was seen by Ishika in the forest.(Corect)
(a) The tiger saw by Ishika in the forest.(Incorrect Verb)
(b) The tiger was seen by the forest in Ishika.(Incorrect Sentence Structure)
(d) The tiger sees Ishika in the forest.(Incorrect Sentence Structure)

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.
Innuendo
solution:
(d)Insinuation- to suggest, without being direct, that something unpleasant is true.
Innuendo- indirect reference to something rude or unpleasant.
Prose- written language in its ordinary form rather than poetry.
Crude- rude and offensive.
Ragged- (of clothes) torn and not in good condition.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.
‘Spy Family’ is a graphic novel that is a narrative work in which the story is conveyed to the reader using uninterrupted art in a traditional comics format.
solution:
(a) sequential art in a traditional
‘Sequential’ means in a logical order. The given sentence states that ‘Spy Family’ is a graphic novel that is a narrative work in which the story is conveyed to the reader using sequential art in a traditional comics format. Hence, 'sequential art in a traditional' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.
Fatal
solution:
(a)Deadly- causing or able to cause death.
Fatal- resulting in death.
Additional- added or extra.
Jovial- cheerful and friendly.

question:
The following sentence has been divided into four segments. Identify the segment that contains an error.
Mr. Abhilash and his family / have received / no informations / about the incident.
solution:
(b) no informations
‘Informations’ must be replaced with ‘information’ as ‘information’ is an uncountable noun and its plural cannot be formed. Hence, 'no information' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the opposite meaning of the underlined word.
The explosive used is of my own formulation, and I can vouch for its efficiency.
solution:
(c)Invalidate- to make something not true.
Vouch- to confirm or assert the truth of something.
Maintain- to keep something in good condition.
Certify- to officially recognize or confirm something.
Witness- to see or observe an event happening.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
Vinod had a ________ escape in the car accident
solution:
(c) narrow
The phrase ‘narrow escape’ means a situation in which an accident or other unfortunate incident is only just avoided. The given sentence states that Vinod had a narrow escape in the car accident. Hence, 'narrow' is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(c)Relevent
'Relevant' is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the word in bold.
We’d better watch our step and not give him any excuse to harass us further.
solution:
(d)Intimidate- to frighten or make someone feel afraid.
Harass- to disturb or bother someone repeatedly.
Betray- to reveal or disclose information that is meant to be kept secret.
Relish- to enjoy or take great pleasure in something.
Soothe- to calm or alleviate pain or discomfort.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given phrase.
A short interesting story about a real person or event
solution:
(c)Anecdote- a short interesting story about a real person or event.
Poem- a piece of writing in which the words are arranged in separate lines, often ending in rhyme, and are chosen for their sound and for the images and ideas they suggest.
Sketch- a simple, quickly-made drawing that does not have many details.
Narrative- a spoken or written account of connected events.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the underlined group of words.
She is proficient in speaking many languages.
solution:
(b) Multilingual- proficient in speaking many languages.
Monolithic- formed of a single large block of stone.
Heterolinguistic- pertaining to or characterized by the use of different languages.
Bilingual- a person who speaks two languages equally well.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
To have bigger fish to fry
option_2: To know different kinds of fishing techniques
option_4: To have bigger things to take care of than the menial task at hand
solution:
(d)To have bigger fish to fry- to have bigger things to take care of than the menial task at hand.
E.g.- I can't worry about that small project right now. I have bigger fish to fry.

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.
My brother performed / extremely good / in the class test / held yesterday.
solution:
(d)extremely good
‘Good’ must be replaced with 'well' as the given sentence needs an adverb to modify the verb ‘performed’, and not an adjective ‘good’. Hence, 'extremely well' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.
Toxic
solution:
(c)Lethal- capable of causing death.
Toxic- poisonous or harmful to living beings.
Laudatory- expressing praise or commendation.
Lanky- tall and thin, often in an awkward way.
Licit- permitted by law.

question: Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words. A person who likes to argue about anything
solution:
(d)Contentious- a person who likes to argue about anything.
Reticent- unwilling to speak about your thoughts or feelings.
Coward- a person who is not brave, is easily frightened, or tries to avoid danger or difficulties.
Veracious- speaking or representing the truth.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.
She has been studying for two o’clock .
solution:
(b) studying since two o’clock
‘Since’ is used to indicate the point of time when something started. Similarly, the given sentence states the time when she started studying. Hence, “studying since two o’ clock” is the most appropriate answer.

question:
In the following sentence, four words are underlined out of which one word is misspelt. Identify the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
After the recapture (A) of Tololing and the adjacent features, evacting (B) the enemy from this well-fortified (C) position became a priority.(D)
solution:
(a) (B) evacting
'Evicting' is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.
Lovely tunes are composed by Domnica.
solution:
(d) Domnica composes lovely tunes. (Correct)
(a) Domnica composed lovely tunes. (Incorrect Tense)
(b) Domnica composes tunes lovely. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)
(c) Domnica will compose lovely tunes. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the word which means the same as the group of words given.
Unit of weight for precious stones
solution:
(c)Carat- unit of weight for precious stones.
Pure- not mixed or adulterated with any other substance or material.
Reliable- able to be trusted.
Accurate- correct, exact, and without any mistakes.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym to replace the underlined word in the given sentence.
No altruistic act is truly sincere.
solution:
(a)Philanthropic- seeking to promote the welfare of others, especially through the donation of money to good causes.
Altruistic- showing selfless concern for the well-being of others.
Phantasmal- not existing in nature or subject to explanation according to natural laws.
Phenomenal- remarkable or exceptional, especially exceptionally good.
Phonotypical- relating to or denoting a system of writing in which each symbol represents a spoken sound.

question:
Cloze Test:
There is a saying that coming events cast their shadows before. (96)________, it is not universally true. Something can happen within a second, and one may not (97)________ it. (98)________, some instances show that predictions based on certain signs have gone wrong. People generally say that natural calamities can be predicted by observing the animals. But what if animals are suffering from some disease and don’t show any signs before the event appears? They may fail to make peculiar sounds or actions about the events which are going to take place. (99)________, some unnatural calamities that are likely to appear may forecast their shadows by some bad omens. (100)________, we should not completely cancel out the possibilities that animals can sense certain unnatural happenings.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 96.
solution:
(d)However
‘However’ is used to introduce a statement that contrasts with the previous information. The given passage states that coming events cast their shadows before and then states a contrasting idea that it is not universally true. Hence, 'however' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
There is a saying that coming events cast their shadows before. (96)________, it is not universally true. Something can happen within a second, and one may not (97)________ it. (98)________, some instances show that predictions based on certain signs have gone wrong. People generally say that natural calamities can be predicted by observing the animals. But what if animals are suffering from some disease and don’t show any signs before the event appears? They may fail to make peculiar sounds or actions about the events which are going to take place. (99)________, some unnatural calamities that are likely to appear may forecast their shadows by some bad omens. (100)________, we should not completely cancel out the possibilities that animals can sense certain unnatural happenings.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 97.
solution:
(b)foresee
‘Foresee’ means to realize or understand something in advance or before it happens. The given passage states that something can happen within a second, and one may not foresee it. Hence, 'foresee' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
There is a saying that coming events cast their shadows before. (96)________, it is not universally true. Something can happen within a second, and one may not (97)________ it. (98)________, some instances show that predictions based on certain signs have gone wrong. People generally say that natural calamities can be predicted by observing the animals. But what if animals are suffering from some disease and don’t show any signs before the event appears? They may fail to make peculiar sounds or actions about the events which are going to take place. (99)________, some unnatural calamities that are likely to appear may forecast their shadows by some bad omens. (100)________, we should not completely cancel out the possibilities that animals can sense certain unnatural happenings.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 98
solution:
(b)Moreover
‘Moreover’ is used to provide additional information about something. Similarly, the given passage provides additional information that predictions based on certain signs have gone wrong. Hence, 'Moreover' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
There is a saying that coming events cast their shadows before. (96)________, it is not universally true. Something can happen within a second, and one may not (97)________ it. (98)________, some instances show that predictions based on certain signs have gone wrong. People generally say that natural calamities can be predicted by observing the animals. But what if animals are suffering from some disease and don’t show any signs before the event appears? They may fail to make peculiar sounds or actions about the events which are going to take place. (99)________, some unnatural calamities that are likely to appear may forecast their shadows by some bad omens. (100)________, we should not completely cancel out the possibilities that animals can sense certain unnatural happenings.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 99
solution:
(a)Besides
‘Besides’ means furthermore or in addition to. The given passage further states that some unnatural calamities that are likely to appear may forecast their shadows by some bad omens. Hence, 'Besides' is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
There is a saying that coming events cast their shadows before. (96)________, it is not universally true. Something can happen within a second, and one may not (97)________ it. (98)________, some instances show that predictions based on certain signs have gone wrong. People generally say that natural calamities can be predicted by observing the animals. But what if animals are suffering from some disease and don’t show any signs before the event appears? They may fail to make peculiar sounds or actions about the events which are going to take place. (99)________, some unnatural calamities that are likely to appear may forecast their shadows by some bad omens. (100)________, we should not completely cancel out the possibilities that animals can sense certain unnatural happenings.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 100
solution:
(d)Therefore
‘Therefore’ is used to introduce a logical conclusion or result. The given passage states a conclusion that we should not completely cancel out the possibilities that animals can sense certain unnatural happenings. Hence, 'Therefore' is the most appropriate answer.
